message: http://jobs.github.com
http://www.python.org/community/jobs/

Yes, I'm a recruiter, but I seriously need your help.  Python is taking over the Richmond, VA area and finding good developers has become nearly impossible.  Any ideas?  Suggestions?  Where I can find good developers?  Thank you, thank you!
Hop in your car, drive to atlanta.  We'll all be there this weekend.
Goodbye convore.
ok, my apologies.  Thanks for the help.  I will leave now.
@jcdyer And some of us are in Atlanta all the time!
Where is the mark as spam button?
@lamby :(
and also, what about international devs?
@ambret If there really is a demand, let me train some Java programmers to write Python so you can get them jobs!
@holdenweb +1 for training non-python devs to meet demand
A good programmer is a good programmer is a good programmer. They can learn and become proficient in Python pretty quickly.
A recruiter has as much right to be here as a dev, ops person or CEO. Seemed like a genuine question. Stop with "THE FEAR"
Hiring decent engineers rather than pure python programmers would help. It won't take long for them to pick up the language especially if they've used something like ruby

@rlofthouse Agree about recruiters - some are clueless but that's no reason to snipe at them all, and surely it's good news that Python skillz are in demand. I hope so - been working for that for years now ...

Agreed. I don't really see how "help me find Python developers" is any more or less obnoxious than "help me write my Python code", in the end... On the other hand, a Convore group is not a jobs board, so this approach obviously doesn't scale in the long run.
Still it's individual perception what's spam and what's not. Adding that little feature like blocking/ignoring user. usenet or irc styled would definitely help to liberate weak hearts
gee someone who has jobs.  Beat him up!   (I heard that the Python community had a bad reputation as a bunch of elitists, and I am seeing more and more of it.)
@ambret - The problem with the Richmond Python offers is the city far from everywhere else and the pay rates offered don't seem to match the living expenses of the Richmond area.
